project_starter_prompt.system_message: You are an expert C++ programming instructor and mentor. Your goal is to help students understand assignment requirements, plan their implementation, and write high-quality code that will receive excellent grades. Provide detailed, actionable guidance that considers both the assignment requirements and best programming practices.

code_structure.description: How well the code is organized into logical components
code_structure.excellent: Clear separation of concerns, appropriate use of classes/functions, logical file organization
code_structure.good: Reasonable organization with some class usage

functionality.description: Does the code meet all specified requirements
functionality.excellent: All requirements implemented correctly with extra features
functionality.good: Core requirements met, some advanced features
functionality.needs_improvement: Missing key requirements or incorrect implementation

code_quality.description: Readability, efficiency, and adherence to C++ best practices
code_quality.excellent: Clean, efficient, well-documented code following C++ standards
code_quality.needs_improvement: Hard to read, inefficient, or uses poor practices

error_handling.description: How well the program handles edge cases and errors
error_handling.excellent: Comprehensive error handling with meaningful messages
error_handling.good: Basic error handling for common cases
error_handling.needs_improvement: No error handling or crashes on edge cases

testing.excellent: Comprehensive test cases, handles edge cases
testing.good: Basic test cases for main functionality
testing.needs_improvement: No apparent testing or fails basic cases

code_review_prompt.system_message: You are a senior C++ developer conducting a code review. Focus on providing constructive feedback that helps students improve their coding skills while being encouraging and specific about what needs to be fixed.
code_review_prompt.user_prompt_template:
Please review my C++ code for {assignment_type} and provide detailed feedback:

CODE:
{code}

ASSIGNMENT REQUIREMENTS:
{requirements}

GRADING CRITERIA:
{grading_criteria}

Please provide:
1. Overall assessment of code quality
2. Specific issues that need to be fixed
3. Suggestions for improvement
4. How these changes will affect the grade
5. Best practices to follow for future assignments

critical_issues.description: Must-fix issues that prevent code from working or compiling

major_improvements.description: Significant improvements that substantially impact code quality

minor_improvements.description: Small improvements that enhance code quality

best_practices.description: Recommendations for following C++ best practices

implementation_guidance_prompt.system_message: You are a C++ programming tutor specializing in helping students implement complex assignments. Provide step-by-step guidance, code examples, and explanations that build understanding while ensuring the final code will receive high grades.
implementation_guidance_prompt.user_prompt_template:
I need detailed guidance for implementing {assignment_type}. I understand the requirements but need help with the implementation approach.

ASSIGNMENT DETAILS:
{description}

SPECIFIC AREA I NEED HELP WITH:
{help_topic}

MY CURRENT CODE (if any):
{current_code}

Please provide:
1. Step-by-step implementation plan
2. Code examples and explanations
3. Common pitfalls to avoid
4. Testing strategies
5. How to ensure high grades

planning.description: Analyze requirements and design solution architecture

implementation.description: Write the actual code following best practices

testing.description: Validate that code works correctly and meets requirements

B_range.description: Good work that meets most expectations

C_range.description: Adequate work that meets basic requirements

D_range.description: Below average work with significant issues
criteria: Code works but has major issues

F_range.description: Unsatisfactory work that doesn't meet requirements
criteria: No effort to follow best practices

edge_cases.description: Handling of edge cases and error conditions

cpp_features.description: Proper use of C++ language features

separate_concerns.solution: Create separate functions for different responsibilities
separate_concerns.example: Extract input reading, processing, and output into separate functions
separate_concerns.benefit: Easier to test, debug, and maintain

use_classes.solution: Create classes to represent domain objects
use_classes.example: Create Student, Course, Grade classes instead of using arrays

file_organization.solution: Split code into multiple files (.h and .cpp)

error_handling.solution: Add try-catch blocks and input validation
error_handling.example: Check file opening, validate user input, handle exceptions

documentation.example: Document function purposes, complex algorithms, assumptions
documentation.benefit: Code is easier to understand and maintain

naming_conventions.example: studentCount instead of x, calculateGrade() instead of func()

algorithm_efficiency.solution: Choose appropriate data structures and algorithms
algorithm_efficiency.example: Use std::vector instead of arrays, std::map for lookups

memory_management.problem: Memory leaks or inefficient memory usage
memory_management.solution: Use RAII, smart pointers, proper cleanup
memory_management.example: Use std::unique_ptr, std::shared_ptr, avoid raw pointers
memory_management.benefit: Prevents memory leaks and improves performance
